words.quizzes_studio_home_question_math_conten: Set the initial content and the correct answer for your question
words.quizzes_studio_home_question_text_conten: Set the the correct answer for your question
words.quizzes_studio_home_question_graph_conte: Draw the initial content and correct answer for your question
words.quizzes_studio_customize_graph_toolbar_l: Choose tools to be provided to the student to answer the question.
words.quizzes_studio_options_filter_label: Filter the options based on an analysis of the correct answer.
words.quizzes_studio_input_options_compound_an: Evaluate each answer box independently. Otherwise the whole content is evaluated as a single value. Answer boxes are defined in Initial content.
If any of the answers is not correct, the whole question will be graded as not correct. Otherwise each answer has a weight in the grade.
words.quizzes_studio_input_options_answer_inpu: The fully featured MathType math editor with toolbar and handwriting input modes.
A text field with a button that launches the MathType math editor in a popup.
Just a plain text field, for simpler answers.
Display an auxiliary CalcMe calculator in addition to the standard student answer field.
Display an auxiliary text field in addition to the standard student answer field.
Replace answer input with auxiliary CalcMe
Replace the answer input field with an auxiliary CalcMe calculator for the student answer.
Don’t show the auxiliary CalcMe calculator for the student answer input field.
Hide options such as opening, saving, or downloading CalcMe documents to students
words.quizzes_studio_input_options_input_synta: Choose the letters that are interpreted as constants instead of free variables. You may define more constants at Define random variables and functions panel.
Choose the names that are interpreted as functions. You may define more functions at Define random variables and functions panel.
Choose names that are interpreted as units of measure.
Choose the prefixes that are allowed with units of measure.
The curly brackets { } are interpreted as list enclosers. Otherwise they are interpreted as parentheses.
Any element or sequence of elements are interpreted as a list, even without the enclosers { }.
Formulas like (0,1) are interpreted as intervals. Otherwise they are vectors of two elements.
Formulas like 2:3:5 are interpreted as ratios. Otherwise they are successive regular divisions.
Formulas like 1.5e-5 or 1.5E-5 are interpreted as decimal numbers in scientific notation.
Choose the meaning of point, comma and space symbols. It defines how decimal digits and lists must be expressed.
words.quizzes_studio_validation_options_studen: Comparison with student answer
Literally equal
The student answer must be typed exactly as the correct answer, except for parentheses and equivalent operators. Tolerance still apply.
Mathematically equal
The student answer is compared with the correct answer using the mathematical engine.
Order and repetition matter in lists
If the answer is a list of elements, the elements in the students’ answer must be in the same order and appear the same number of times as in the correct answer.
Repetition matters in lists, but order does not
If the answer is a list of elements, the elements in the students’ answer must appear the same number of times as in the correct answer, but not necessarily in the same order.
Order and repetition do not matter in lists
If the answer is a list of elements, do not consider their order and the repetition of them to compare the students’ answer and the correct answer.
Match letter case
Capital and lowercase letters must match exactly.
Match spaces
There must be exactly the same spaces in student answer than in correct answer.
Equivalent equations
The set of solutions of the equation, inequation or system defined by the student answer is the same as the one defined by the correct answer.
Any answer
Match all student answers. Use this option to give feedback to students on wrong answers.
Custom grading function
Define your own custom function to check the student answer at Define random variables and functions panel.
Function name
Define a new function
Unevaluated
The student answer will not be evaluated and will be given to the function as a CalcMe Expression. This is a very advanced feature.
words.quizzes_studio_validation_options_number: Do not allow decimal numbers. The answer must be a combination of operations, fractions, roots and functions of integers, constants and variables.
The student answer must be exactly equal to the correct answer.
The student answer must be strictly within the tolerance interval.
The first significant figures or decimal places of the student answer must match the correct answer.
Decimal numbers in student answer must be expressed in normalized scientific notation:
Decimal numbers must be expressed in plain decimal notation: 0.0224
Decimal numbers may be expressed either in scientific or in decimal notation.
Check the minimum and maximum number of significant figures or decimal places the student answer must have, including trailing zeros.
words.quizzes_studio_validation_options_simpli: The expression can not be further simplified. Includes fractions, powers and roots, polynomials, rational functions, transcendental functions, decimal numbers...
All operations that can be done are performed. Products are distributed over sums, simple fractions are operated.
Integers or polynomials are expressed as products of primes.
Common factors of sums have been extracted.
Fractions are simplified to a single common denominator.
There are no roots in the denominator.
The argument of roots does not have any factor powered to the index of the root, so it can’t be simplified.
words.quizzes_studio_validation_options_measur: The unit of measure of the student answer must be the same as the correct answer.
Allow the unit of measure of the student answer to have a different prefix than the correct answer.
words.quizzes_studio_graph_validation_options_: Set the amount of error allowed between the student answer and the correct answer.
Select the elements in the answer to be evaluated
Prohibit superfluous elements in the student answer
There can not be more elements in the student answer than elements present in the correct answer.
The elements in the student answer must have the same color as the ones in the correct answer.
The elements in the student answer must have the same line type (solid, dashed) as the ones in the correct answer.
There was an error loading the graph validation elements. Please try again.

words.quizzes_studio_import_dialog_label: The question you are about to open contains deprecated features. The import process may change slightly the behavior of the question. It is highly recommended that you carefully test the question after import.
words.quizzes_studio_relevant_options_dialog_l: The options selected are incompatible with the deducted assertions from your Correct Answer. Are you sure you want to continue?.
words.popup_text_field_warning_message: If you close this window you will lose all unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to proceed?
words.clicktoeditalgorithm: Click the button to download and run Wiris CAS application to edit the question algorithm.
words.clicktoruncalculator: Click the button to download and run Wiris CAS application to make the calculations you need.
words.quizzes_studio_variables_options_cas_alg: The question algorithm will be imported from Wiris CAS to our new algorithm editor, CalcMe. The resulting algorithm must be manually revised and tested. Algorithms imported to CalcMe cannot be opened with Wiris CAS anymore. If you want to undo the import after accepting, do not save the question: click cancel in the Wiris Quizzes Studio window and open it again. For complex algorithms that include programming logic, use the "Convert as algorithm" option for a better performance and ease of use.
words.quizzes_studio_home_correct_answer_descr: Enter the correct answer for this question. You can modify the criteria used to compare it to your students' answer using the validation options menu.
Enter the correct answer for this question. You can modify how it is compared to your students' answer and which elements are graded using the settings menu.
Enter the correct answer for this question. You can modify the criteria used to compare it to your students' answer using the validation options menu.
words.quizzes_studio_home_initial_content_desc: This is the initial state of the math editor your students will see when attempting the question. This way you can provide a structure for their answer or blanks to fill in.
This is the initial state of the graph editor your students will see when attempting the question. You can customize the toolbar elements they will see in the input options.
This is the initial state of the text editor your students will see when attempting the question. This answer type is not evaluated mathematically.
words.quizzes_studio_home_product_message_text: You can now enjoy our new random variables feature, that allows you to create dynamic questions in a faster and straightforward way.
words.quizzes_studio_home_product_message_rele: Take a look at our release notes.
words.quizzes_studio_input_options_answer_inpu: Do not allow the student to modify the answer outside of the empty placeholders left in the initial content. If this setting is enabled the student will only be able to fill in the boxes of the initial content.
Select the display setting of the labels' name and value. You can decide if the student sees the labels' value always, never or when they are focus.
Select the magnetic grid option for the student answer field.
words.quizzes_studio_home_random_variables_des: Make your questions dynamic by adding random variables to your question statement. Don’t forget to add these variables in the correct answer and if you want them to appear evaluated then add the command evaluate.
words.quizzes_studio_home_random_variables_sim: Make your questions dymanic by adding random variables to your question statement. Don’t forget to add these variables in the correct answer and if you want them to appear evaluated then add the command evaluate.
words.quizzes_studio_home_random_variables_str: Use CalcMe to write an algorithm to generate random variables!
words.quizzes_studio_home_random_variables_com: You have a complex algorithm, use the advanced mode!
words.home_getting_started_welcome_description: We're excited to introduce a new answer type that allows your students to respond by handwriting a graph. To learn more about this feature, check out our release notes and documentation. We hope you and your students enjoy this new addition to WirisQuizzes!

words.home_getting_started_create_question_tex: Learn all the steps to create a question with WirisQuizzes and how to use its validation features.
words.home_getting_started_create_random_quest: How to create a random question
Learn how to easily create a random question with WirisQuizzes with our basic and advanced modes.
words.home_getting_started_training_panel_head: Learn everything about WirisQuizzes with our free training
words.home_getting_started_training_panel_text: We offer the option of a free self-paced training and of a tutored paid training where you can learn all about WirisQuizzes features and advanced settings.
words.quizzes_studio_home_initial_content_desc: This is the initial content state of the graph editor your students will see when attempting the question. Keep in mind that the students toolbar will only have handwriting and deletion buttons. Use the 'test this question' feature to see how it will look like.
words.quizzes_studio_home_correct_answer_descr: Enter the correct answer for this question. Your students will use the handwriting tool to sketch their solution, so we've set a minimal tolerance for slightly inaccurate answers. You can adjust this by clicking on 'validation options'.
Use the 'test this question' button to see the student's view.

words.quizzes_studio_math_input_options_input_: It conventionally accepts the multiplication of elements that are written consecutively. Example: 2y is interpreted as 2 times y.
Elements operated with the dot or asterisc denote multplication. Example: 2 · y is interpreted as 2 times y.
Elements operated with the cross denote multplication. Example: 2 × y is interpreted as 2 times y.
words.quizzes_studio_multistep_error_session_s: Something went wrong while trying to load your task. Please try again or go back to make sure the task is correctly defined.
